alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 10:35PM EST until December 28 at 4:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by high flows along the Broad River near and below the Ninety Nine Islands Dam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Cherokee and York. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Broad River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1027 PM EST, The pool elevation at the Ninety Nine Islands Dam along the Broad River in Cherokee County was around 104 feet. Minor flooding is known to occur along and near the river channel at and above this pool elevation. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cherokee Falls and Draytonville. - Parts of Ninety Nine Ferry Road will begin to flood as well as nearby farmland up and down the river channel. At an elevation of 105 feet, water could approach the Cherokee Ford complex access road downstream of the dam due to backwater effects along Peoples Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
